text: The people of Chicago are fired up for big, structural change. And I promise: As president, I’ll fight for your families as hard as I fight for mine. Thank you, Chicago! http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EKt81PQXkAAhFnw.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EKt81PPX0AEcpQA.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EKt81PQWoAAajS7.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EKt81PQW4AAeJx7.jpg

My goal is to get elected—but I plan to be the last American president to be elected by the Electoral College. I want my second term to be elected by direct vote. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EKwZ0iqXsAA7RFI.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1201362954823839744/vid/320x320/dU-kgaVIfrPH32Pg.mp4?tag=13

No billionaires, super PACs or corporate lobbyists are supporting us, and we wouldn’t have it any other way. We are the strongest campaign to defeat Trump because we have millions of working people powering our campaign. https://www.pscp.tv/w/cLQkUDMyNzU3OTl8MVJEeGxOV3ZBclZHTOGJxYJzv1JA0V3HyIvHfBwGXQNPXRr-t7TGNo2nV80d

Coal miners are not the enemy.

Oil rig workers are not the enemy.

Climate change is the enemy.

As we transition to 100% renewable energy, the Green New Deal will ensure a just transition for ALL fossil fuel workers.

We have all the tools we need to end AIDS deaths and HIV transmissions. We just need the political will to do it. When we are in the White House, we will set a national goal of ending the HIV epidemic in the U.S. by the year 2025. #WorldAIDSDay

Trump cut taxes massively for his rich buddies, and now he wants to cut off and reduce SNAP benefits for millions of the poorest Americans. This is how corruption keeps Washington working for the wealthy and well-connected, but not for everyone else. https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/trump-administration-proposal-could-cause-millions-lose-food-stamps-n1092866

Today we reflect on the great strides the US & intl community have made in the fight against HIV/AIDS and in ending the stigma around it. Now is not the time to retreat on that progress. This #WorldAIDSDay we recommit to advancing the critical work ahead to #EndAids for good. http://pbs.twimg.com/tweet_video_thumb/EKoLMcGXYAAp_zV.jpg https://video.twimg.com/tweet_video/EKoLMcGXYAAp_zV.mp4

People ask whether love can beat Trump, but if you look at our collective history, love is the *only* way we can win. From Seneca Falls to Selma and Stonewall, we've beaten hate and demagogues before—when we've come together.

Watch and share my campaign’s newest ad here: http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EKtfmBZWkAIAMZP.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1201155725331968002/vid/480x270/n8mkVYzL7O7Ie-JJ.mp4?tag=13

On #WorldAIDSDay, we gather to remember the many lives lost to the AIDS epidemic, we stand shoulder to shoulder with those who live today with HIV, and we recommit ourselves to ending this epidemic. https://www.cnn.com/2019/12/01/opinions/world-aids-day-reminder-elizabeth-warren/index.html

On this day in 1955, Rosa Parks decided enough was enough—and refused to give up her seat on a bus in Montgomery, AL. The courage she embodied during the Civil Rights movement continues to inspire me today. We must honor her legacy by continuing to fight for justice and equality.

We are in a fight for democracy, for justice and for the rule of law.

There’s a criminal enterprise afoot. 

And we need to bring in all the president’s men—everyone from Pence to Pompeo.

Last year South Carolina spent:

$21,756 per prison inmate
$11,552 per student

It makes no rational sense to invest more in keeping people in prison than keeping them in school.

As president, I will do everything I can to reverse this absurdity.

When I first ran for Senate in 2012, I was up against a popular Republican incumbent. The naysayers told me, “Massachusetts isn’t ready for a woman senator.”

We proved them wrong. I’m not afraid of a fight—even a big one. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EKuRINNWoAQQufG.jpg

That bill would’ve increased pay for up to 27 million working people. The Senate GOP has yet to bring it to a vote. 

The Republican Party keeps going out of its way to keep Americans in poverty.

Keeping the victims of the New Orleans shooting and their families in my prayers as our nation wakes up to news of another mass shooting.

When will it end?

As president, I won't bend to the @NRA. If Congress fails to act to end this epidemic, I'll take executive action myself. https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1201149756581568515 QT @washingtonpost At least 11 injured in shooting near French Quarter, New Orleans police say https://trib.al/C2vBWtH

The top .0025% saw their wealth double in the last decade and their tax rate fall.

We have the money to provide basic necessities to our people.

What we need is the courage to take on the corporate elite.

From Ohio to Arkansas, an all-out assault is being waged on reproductive rights. I won’t stand for it. As president, my DOJ will block any unconstitutional anti-abortion laws before they can take effect.

A majority of those living with HIV today are LGBTQ+ people from communities of color, who especially in the South, often face too many barriers to health care. RT @nytimes By day, New York’s 114,085 homeless students live in plain sight: They study on the subway and sprint through playgrounds. At night, these children sometimes sleep in squalid, unsafe rooms. School is the only stable place they know. https://trib.al/zAigMEG

Nearly 40 million are living with HIV around the world with nearly 2 million more diagnosed every year. On #WorldAIDSDay we remember those we’ve lost to this disease, recommit to ending the HIV epidemic, & continue to work together toward a future without stigma & discrimination.

We have made great progress but too many people living with HIV and AIDS are suffering because they can’t afford the medicine they need.

With Medicare for All, we will cap out-of-pocket prescription costs at $200 a year and end price gouging on life-saving drugs. #WorldAIDSDay

There are nearly 40 million people living with HIV around the world. On #WorldAIDSDay, it is my commitment to you that we end HIV and AIDS within a generation. It’s on us to improve education, end the stigma, and work together to fight discrimination.

Despite the progress and medical advancements, we still have a lot of work to do to end the HIV/AIDS epidemic. I've got a plan to provide more resources to tackle this epidemic and begin publicly manufacturing PrEP in my first 100 days. #WorldAIDSDay https://elizabethwarren.com/plans/lgbtq-equality?source=soc-WB-ew-tw

For those of us who witnessed the HIV/AIDS epidemic, the memories of those lost linger in our hearts. We must reaffirm our commitment stopping the spread of HIV.

That's why PrEP is so important. I introduced a bill to improve access to and coverage of PrEP. #WorldAIDSDay
